front.div:
1 Introduction It is well known that the preparation
of the substrate surface may have a tremendous influence
on the properties of the subsequent epitaxial layers. One of
the crucial parameters is the wafer miscut, a parameter of
importance for establishing the optimum growth conditions
[1, 2]. Wafer miscut predetermines the number of atomic
steps on the surface thus influencing the step flow mecha-
nism of growth (Fig. 1). In case of nitride structures
(GaN–InGaN–AlGaN) fabricated on bulk gallium nitride
substrates the knowledge of the influence of the surface tilt
on the physical properties of the grown layers is much lim-
ited due to the technical difficulty in preparation GaN
misoriented crystals. Most of the free-standing GaN crys-
tals are almost "on axis" with the respect to standard polar
c-plane. Polishing, or cutting under larger angle requires
